channel.title: MBallSectionsDR
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from MBallSectionsDR, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New York Democratic Rep. Jerry Nadler says he won't run for reelection
item.description: Democratic Rep. Jerry Nadler of New York says he will not run for reelection next year, according to an interview published Monday night by The New Yo...

item.title: High Adventure Is Still Good Business
item.description: One hundred and fifty years since his birth, Edgar Rice Burroughs has a lasting literary legacy that lives beyond his own work.

item.title: Management’s Favorite Unions Don’t March for Everyone
item.description: This Labor Day, listen to the workers whom union officials have left behind.

item.title: Celebrating the Decline of Big Labor
item.description: For the first time, the share of U.S. workers who are union members has fallen below 10 percent.

item.title: Putin shores up ties with India and China while U.S, EU plan way forward on Ukraine
item.description: A defiant Vladimir Putin thumbed his nose at the West by embracing Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi and China's Xi Jinping on Monday, leaving no si...

item.title: This Labor Day, Ask Why States Like California Restrict Freelance Work
item.description: Six Labor Days later, Assembly Bill 5 remains an adversarial law that handcuffs independent professionals' ability to work as they choose.

item.title: Trump to award Medal of Freedom to Rudy Giuliani
item.description: President Trump plans to award former New York City Mayor Rudolph W. Giuliani the Presidential Medal of Freedom, a prestigious distinction for civilia...

item.title: 1.2 million immigrants are gone from the U.S. labor force under Trump, preliminary data shows
item.description: It's tomato season and Lidia is harvesting on farms in California's Central Valley.

item.title: A House committee investigating the Jeffrey Epstein case has withdrawn a subpoena to Robert Mueller
item.description: A House committee investigating the Justice Department's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein sex trafficking case has withdrawn a subpoena to former FBI D...

item.title: Trump Is Right to Take On the Federal-Worker Unions
item.description: Labor Day should honor laborers, not unions.

item.title: Study: Having A Husband And Kids Doubles Women’s Likelihood Of Being Happy
item.description: A new study looks at how marriage and motherhood are linked to one another and to women’s happiness.

item.title: Taylor Lorenz Has the Goods (Really) on the Left’s Paid Online Influencers
item.description: There is an invisible world out there, a hidden hand, and it is driven by money.

item.title: Meet The Pivotal Figure Who Helped Resurrect The American Right
item.description: Is Frank S. Meyer's vision of 'fusionism' still the best path forward for the American right?

item.title: 20 Years Later, New Orleans Triumphs Over Hurricane Katrina’s Tragedy
item.description: The way the citizens of New Orleans united to restore their home and regain their destiny should serve as an inspiration to us all.

item.title: Lee Corso Epitomizes The Spectacle Of Modern College Football
item.description: On Saturday, Lee Corso will make his final appearance on College GameDay , the ESPN show he has worked for since its inception in 1987.
